## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Configuration or infrastructure change
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes)

## Testing

<!-- Describe the tests you ran to verify your changes -->
<!-- Provide instructions so others can reproduce -->

- [ ] Tests pass locally (`pytest`)
- [ ] Code passes linting (`ruff check`)
- [ ] Code is formatted (`ruff format`)
- [ ] Type checking passes (`ty check`)

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the Python coding standards in `.github/instructions/python-coding-standards.instructions.md`
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented my code where needed (only where clarification is needed)
- [ ] I have updated documentation if relevant
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

## Language-Specific Considerations

<!-- Check all that apply -->

- [ ] Python: Uses modern 3.12+ type hints (`dict[]`, `list[]`, `|` for unions)
- [ ] Python: Avoids LLM detection markers (no "robust", "seamless", etc.)
- [ ] TypeScript: Follows project conventions
- [ ] Go: Follows project conventions
- [ ] .NET: Follows project conventions
